Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: MUD TYPE: The media type (also known as mud type or drilling fluid type) present inthe wellbore. For example chemical gel mud, crude oil, native mud...
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: FILTRATE RESISTIVITY: A surface measurement of the mud filtrate resistivity at areported temperature.
Column Comment.10: FILTRATE RESISTIVITY OUOM: Filtrate resistivity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: FILTRATE SALINITY: The salinity of the mud filtrate (the total weight of dissolvedsalts in the fluid invading the permeable zone behind wellbore).
Column Comment.12: FILTRATE SALINITY OUOM: Filtrate salinity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.13: FILTRATE SALINITY UNITS OF MEASURE: the reported units of measure for thefiltrate salinity, usually expressed as PPM or GPG (Grains per gallon)
Column Comment.14: FILTRATE TEMPERATURE: The reported temperature at which the mud filtratetemperature was measured.
Column Comment.15: FILTRATE TEMPERATURE OUOM: Filtrate temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.16: MUD PH: Value for the measurement of alkalinity or acidity of the mud.
Column Comment.17: MUD RESISTIVITY: A surface measurement of the drilling fluid resistivity at areported temperature.
Column Comment.18: MUD RESISTIVITY OUOM: Drilling mud resistivity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.19: MUD SALINITY: The salinity of the drilling mud (the total weight of dissolved salts inthe drilling mud).
Column Comment.20: MUD SALINITY OUOM: Mud salinity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.21: MUD SALINITY UNITS OF MEASURE: the reported data for max mud weight isusually provided ass PPM or GPG (Grains per gallon).
Column Comment.22: MUD SAMPLE TYPE: The type of mud sample used in determining mud resistivity.For example mud cake, filtrate, mud...
Column Comment.23: MUD TEMPERATURE: The reported temperature at which the drilling mud resistivitywas measured.
Column Comment.24: MUD TEMPERATURE OUOM: Drilling mud temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: MUD VISCOSITY: The viscosity of the drilling mud (a measure of the internalresistance or friction of a fluid to flow or stress/rate of shear).
Column Comment.26: MUD VISCOSITY OUOM: Drilling mud viscosity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: MUD WEIGHT: A measurement of the drilling mud density (mass divided by volume).
Column Comment.28: MUD WEIGHT OUOM: Mud weight original unit of measure.
Column Comment.29: MUD WEIGHT UNITS OF MEASURE: the reported data for mud weight is usuallyprovided as PPG (Pounds per gallon) or LB/CF.
Column Comment.30: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.31: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
